setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

cards.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Jamming
abilities.text: After your opponent plays a Supporter card from his or her hand, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Jamming Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

attacks.name: Cluster Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Waterlog
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach as many basic Water Energy cards from your hand to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

cards.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Fury Blaze
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left, each of Charizard's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It is said that CHARIZARD's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

attacks.name: Blast Burn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard. If tails, discard 4 Energy cards attached to Charizard. (If you can't, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Entei

abilities.name: Burning Coat
abilities.text: Whenever 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from Entei's attacks, discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

cards.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Blaze Roar
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Entei.

cards.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Irritating Buzz
abilities.text: As long as Flygon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Active Pokémon between turns, excluding Fighting Pokémon.

cards.text: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."

attacks.name: Sand Sonic
attacks.text: If you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Flygon during this turn, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Gallade
cards.text: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

attacks.name: Sonic Blade
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 50 HP away from being Knocked Out. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Cut
attacks.text: You may choose as many of your face-down Prize cards as you like and put them face up. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Prize card you chose. (These cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)

cards.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Telepass
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your opponent's discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's discard pile.) You can't use more than 1 Telepass Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It will try to guard its trusted Trainer with its life. It has the ability to see the future.

attacks.name: Psychic Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon.

cards.name: Gastrodon East Sea

abilities.name: Osmotic Pressure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Gastrodon West Sea in play, you may move up to 3 damage counters from Gastrodon East Sea to 1 of your Gastrodon West Sea.

cards.text: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Gastrodon East Sea.

cards.name: Gastrodon West Sea
cards.text: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.

attacks.name: Raging Flood
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Gastrodon West Sea. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Gastrodon West Sea.

attacks.name: Wild Waves
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Ho-Oh

abilities.name: Phoenix Turn
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Ho-Oh would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, Ho-Oh isn't discarded. Instead, remove all damage counter, Special Conditions, and other effects from Ho-Oh. Then, discard all cards attached to Ho-Oh (except for Energy cards). This counts as Ho-Oh being Knocked Out and your opponent takes a Prize card.

cards.text: Its feathers are in seven colors. It is said that anyone seeing it is promised eternal happiness.

attacks.name: Rainbow Wing
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of different types of basic Energy cards attached to Ho-Oh.

cards.name: Jumpluff

abilities.name: Cotton Spore
abilities.text: Whenever Jumpluff would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Jumpluff by that attack.

cards.text: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

attacks.name: Cottonweed Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. For each heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting to close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

attacks.name: Tongue Reel
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you choose a Benched Pokémon, switch the Defending Pokémon with that Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to the Pokémon you chose. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lickilicky can't attack.

cards.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Ludicolo.

cards.text: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

attacks.name: Nature Power
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium Card in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Lugia
cards.text: It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings, it is said to cause a 40-day storm.

attacks.name: Silver Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Psychic Destruction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 120.

cards.name: Mew
cards.text: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe MEW to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Balance
attacks.text: If you have less cards in your hand than your opponent, draw cards until you have the same number of cards as your opponent. (If you have more or the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Re-creation
attacks.text: Choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in his or her discard pile. Re-creation copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Mew performs that attack.

cards.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Thunder Rumble
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: It is said to have fallen with lightning. It can fire thunderbolts from the rain clouds on its back.

attacks.name: Thunder Climb
attacks.text: Discard 3 cards from the top of your deck. This attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy card you discarded. Then, attach those Lightning Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Roserade
cards.text: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from Roserade.

cards.name: Salamence
cards.text: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changes, and wings grew out.

attacks.name: Direct Hit
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Finish
attacks.text: Discard 2 basic Fire Energy cards or 2 basic Water Energy cards attached to Salamence. If you discarded 2 basic Fire Energy cards, this attack does 100 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If you discarded 2 Basic Water Energy cards, this attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (If you can't discard cards, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Aqua Recover
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Suicune from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 Water Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

cards.text: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

attacks.name: Cure Stream
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Miracle Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose either Asleep, Burned, or Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Venusaur.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: It senses disasters coming and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.

attacks.name: Baleful Wind
attacks.text: Choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If you discarded a Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium card, choose 1 more card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If you played Absol from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.

cards.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Flame Dash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Arcanine from your hand to evolve 1 of your Benched Pokémon, you may switch Arcanine with 1 of your Active Pokémon. If you do, you may move any number of Energy cards attached to that Pokémon to Arcanine.

cards.text: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.text: Arcanine does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Banette
cards.text: A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from being junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.

attacks.name: Ghost Head
attacks.text: Put as many damage counters as you like on Banette. (You can't put more than Banette's remaining HP.) Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiteful Pain
attacks.text: If Banette is in your discard pile, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage, then search your discard pile for Banette, show it to your opponent, and shuffle it into your deck.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: Its three heads moves alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

attacks.name: Dig Trap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn. If Dugtrio is your Active Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn, put 6 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pit Trap
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

cards.name: Electivire

abilities.name: Motor Drive
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy you discarded. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Energy Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Electrode would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may use this power. Electrode isn't discarded. Instead, attach it as an Energy card to 1 of your Pokémon. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

cards.text: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

attacks.name: Ion Blast
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, Electrode does 100 damage to itself.

cards.name: Furret
cards.text: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

attacks.name: Keen Eye
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Baton Pass
attacks.text: You may switch Furret with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Furret as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Beam
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Golduck is now Confused.

cards.name: Golem
cards.text: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulderlike body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.

attacks.name: Double Throw
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Megaton Rock
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage instead of 80 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Golem by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: It cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

attacks.name: Icy Kiss
attacks.text: If Jynx was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lovely Kiss
attacks.text: Move 2 damage counters from Jynx to the Defending Pokémon. If Smoochum is anywhere under Jynx, move 4 damage counters instead.

cards.name: Magmortar

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.text: When you attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Magmortar, remove 2 damage counters from Magmortar.

cards.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

attacks.name: Flame Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

attacks.name: Fireball Bazooka
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Minun

abilities.name: Minus Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 2 cards. You can't use more than 1 Minus Charge Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Minun is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: Tag Play —
attacks.text: If you have Plusle on your Bench, you may move an Energy card attached to Minun to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Mothim
cards.text: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Scales
attacks.text: If Mothim has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.text: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

attacks.name: Poison Rub
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pride Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Nidoqueen on your Bench. This attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: By flapping its wings with all its might, PIDGEOT can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeot was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Pidgeot to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Plusle

abilities.name: Plus Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't use more than 1 Plus Charge Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Plusle is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Tag Play +
attacks.text: If you have Minun on your Bench, you may do 20 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."

attacks.name: Strike Wound
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. This attack damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Sunflora

abilities.name: Grass Whistle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Grass Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Grass Whistle Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Sunflora is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Sunflora is now Confused.

cards.name: Unown [S]

abilities.name: Set
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown S, Unown E, and Unown T on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Dark Engage
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each of your Active Pokémon's type is Darkness until the end of your turn. If that Pokémon is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.

cards.text: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

attacks.name: Shadow Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Darkness Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

cards.name: Wormadam Plant Cloak

abilities.name: Plant Cloak
abilities.text: If Wormadam Plant Cloak has 2 or more Grass Energy attached to it, Wormadam Plant Cloak gets +40 HP.

cards.text: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Leaf Hurricane
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Wormadam Plant Cloak, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Wormadam Sandy Cloak

abilities.name: Sandy Cloak
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

cards.text: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Push Over
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

cards.name: Wormadam Trash Cloak

abilities.name: Trash Cloak
abilities.text: If Wormadam Trash Cloak has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, any damage done to Wormadam Trash Cloak by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: Wormadam Trash Cloak does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Xatu

abilities.name: Psychic Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Xatu is on your Bench, you may choose 1 Special Condition from 1 of your Active Pokémon and remove that Special Condition. Then, 1 of the Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition that you chose.

cards.text: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

attacks.name: Energy Singe
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Breloom
cards.text: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

attacks.name: Drain Punch
attacks.text: Remove from Breloom a number of damage counters equal to the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Homing Uppercut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0, this attack does 60 damage plus 60 more damage.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: In the rocky mountains where CHARMELEON live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flare Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmeleon and this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Cloyster
cards.text: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Cloyster by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spine Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. For each heads, choose an opponent's Pokémon in play and this attack does 20 damage to those Pokémon. (You may choose the same Pokémon more than once.) (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Donphan
cards.text: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch Donphan with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Bash In
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 damage plus 60 more damage.

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Farfetch'd's Leek Slap attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: During your next turn, Farfetch'd can't use Leek Slap.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Ivysaur.

cards.name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Kecleon is the same as the Attacking Pokémon's type, any damage done by attacks from the Pokémon to Kecleon is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

attacks.name: Blind Scratch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon. Instead, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kirlia
cards.text: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer's feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.

attacks.name: Psychic Research
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your discard pile.)

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Lombre
cards.text: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lombre.

cards.name: Miltank
cards.text: It is said that kids who drink MILTANK's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

attacks.name: Healing Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Sludge
abilities.text: At the end of each player's turn, each of your opponent's Active Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it is now Poisoned. If that Pokémon is already Poisoned, Toxic Sludge Poké-Body does nothing to that Pokémon.

cards.text: A toxic fluids seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

attacks.name: Panic Liquid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

attacks.name: Spirited Drill
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of Nidorino's attacks does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.text: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Power Guillotine
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 100.

cards.name: Quagsire

abilities.name: Aqua Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Quagsire is your Active Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, you may remove 3 damage counters from Quagsire.

cards.text: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

attacks.name: Gnaw Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Sneaky Attack
attacks.text: If Raticate has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Roselia
cards.text: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Sableye
cards.text: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Rummage
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose as many Trainer cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Shadow Sneak
attacks.text: If you and your opponent have a different number of Prize cards left, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Shelgon
cards.text: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Shelgon's Protect Charge attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Protect Charge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shelgon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Skiploom

abilities.name: Cotton Balloon
abilities.text: If Skiploom has any Grass Energy attached to it, any damage done to Skiploom by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch Skiploom with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Smeargle
cards.text: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

attacks.name: Color Pick
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Trace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Trace copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Smeargle performs that attack.

cards.name: Smoochum

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jynx from your hand onto Smoochum (this counts as evolving Smoochum) and remove all damage counters from Smoochum.

cards.text: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.

attacks.name: Psykiss
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

cards.name: Unown [K]

abilities.name: Kind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

cards.name: Unown [N]

abilities.name: Nod
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown N, Unown O, and Unown D on your Bench, you may ask your opponent to take a Prize card. If he or she does, you take a Prize card. If he or she doesn't, draw a card.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Unown [O]

abilities.name: ONE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown O, Unown N, and Unown E on your Bench and you have 1 card left in your hand, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Unown [X]

abilities.name: X-RAY
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown X on your Bench, you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck and put it back on top of his or her deck.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Unown [Z]

abilities.name: ZERO
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Z is on your Bench and you have no cards in your deck, you may discard all cards attached to Unown Z and put Unown Z on top of your deck.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Remove as many damage counters as you like from each Unown you have in play. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Dangerous Scales
abilities.text: If Venomoth is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Venomoth is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.text: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

attacks.name: Disturbance Dive
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of an attack, excluding damage, done to Venomoth during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Vibrava
cards.text: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

attacks.name: Sand Wind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Wartortle can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

cards.name: Bagon
cards.text: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Bagon.

cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

attacks.name: Shake Vine
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Burmy Plant Cloak

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Plant Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Grass Energy card and attach it to Burmy Plant Cloak.

cards.text: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

attacks.name: Plant Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Plant Cloak has any Grass Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Burmy Sandy Cloak

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Sandy Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard for a basic Fighting Energy card and attach it to Burmy Sandy Cloak.

cards.text: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

attacks.name: Sandy Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Sandy Cloak has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Burmy Trash Cloak

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Trash Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard for a basic Metal Energy card and attach it to Burmy Trash Cloak.

cards.text: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

attacks.name: Trash Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Trash Cloak has any Metal Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Carvanha
cards.text: They can swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

attacks.name: Bite Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

attacks.name: Lava Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Moon Stone: Clefairy can evolve during the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Corsola
cards.text: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can't live in polluted waters.

attacks.name: Rally
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

attacks.name: Down Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card from the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Duskull
cards.text: Reaper Cloth: Duskull can evolve during the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electabuzz does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Grimer
cards.text: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

attacks.name: Gunky
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hoppip

abilities.name: Cottonweed
abilities.text: If Hoppip has any Grass Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Hoppip is 0.

cards.text: It drifts on winds. It is said that when HOPPIP gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

attacks.name: Hover Heal
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Hoppip.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Lotad
cards.text: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.

attacks.name: Water Sport
attacks.text: If Lotad has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: Dusk Stone: Murkrow can evolve during the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Natu
cards.text: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

attacks.name: Bothering Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Poison Skin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Phanpy
cards.text: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Phanpy.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Phanpy does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: If its usual headache worsens, its starts exhibiting odd powers. It can't remember doing so, however.

attacks.name: Delusion
attacks.text: If Psyduck is Confused, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Migraine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, Psyduck is now Confused.

cards.name: Qwilfish

abilities.name: Balloon Sting
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Qwilfish is your Active Pokémon and is damage by an attack (even if Qwilfish is Knocked Out), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

cards.text: It shoots the poison spines on its body in all directions. Its round form makes it a poor swimmer.

attacks.name: Nerve Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: It uses the thorns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Sentret
cards.text: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

attacks.name: Grope
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Shellder
cards.text: It swims backwards by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

attacks.name: Shell Rest
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Shellder.

cards.name: Shellos East Sea
cards.text: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

attacks.name: Shell Hunting
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Shellos West Sea and Shellos East Sea and put them on your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Shellos West Sea
cards.text: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Shellos West Sea and remove all damage counters from Shellos West Sea.

cards.name: Shroomish
cards.text: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

attacks.name: Toxic Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Shuckle

abilities.name: Pot Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shuckle by your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

cards.text: It stores berries in its shell. The berries eventually ferment to become delicious juices.

attacks.name: Ferment Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. As long as the Defending Pokémon remains Poisoned by this attack, it can't use any Poké-Body.

cards.name: Shuppet
cards.text: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

attacks.name: Gossip
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Spinda
cards.text: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

attacks.name: Dish Out
attacks.text: Draw a card from the top and the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Synchro Punch
attacks.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Squirtle. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Stantler
cards.text: Staring at its antlers creates an odd sensation as if one were being drawn into their centers.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Frighten Horn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't an Evolved Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Sunkern
cards.text: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. A year after a cold summer, their population explodes.

attacks.name: Sun Soak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from Sunkern, search your deck for an Evolution card that evolves from Sunkern, and put it onto Sunkern. (This counts as evolving Sunkern.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Trapinch
cards.text: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

attacks.name: Inviting Trap
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At nights, its kind is drawn by light.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: Voltorb does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Wooper
cards.text: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Bebe's Search
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

cards.name: Night Maintenance
cards.text: Search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.text: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.,If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Professor Oak's Visit
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw 3 cards. Then, choose a card from your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Professor Rowan
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Choose 1 card in your hand and shuffle the rest of your cards into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

cards.name: Rival
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Your opponent chooses 3 of those cards. Put those cards into your hand and put other 2 cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Roseanne's Research
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Team Galactic's Mars
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw 2 cards. Then, choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and put it on the bottom of his or her deck.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
cards.text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Metal Energy
cards.text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Gardevoir LV.X

abilities.name: Teleportation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), choose 1 of your Active Pokémon or 1 or your Benched Pokémon and switch Gardevoir with that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Gardevoir. Gardevoir LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Bring Down
attacks.text: Choose 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) with the fewest remaining HP (excluding Gardevoir) and that Pokémon is now Knocked Out.

cards.name: Honchkrow LV.X
cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Honchkrow. Honchkrow LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkness Wing
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, you may search your discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.
